title: Maintenance Fluids Calculations (Holliday-Segar Method)
description: Calculates maintenance fluid requirements by weight using the Holliday-Segar method

result.name: maintenance_fluids
result.description: Maintenance fluid requirements per day and per hour

ranges.interpretation: These are the calculated maintenance fluid requirements. Adjust based on clinical condition, losses, and ongoing fluid balance assessment.

references: Holliday MA, Segar WE. The maintenance need for water in parenteral fluid therapy. Pediatrics. 1957 May;19(5):823-32.
Moritz ML, Ayus JC. Prevention of hospital-acquired hyponatremia: a case for using isotonic saline. Pediatrics. 2003 Feb;111(2):227-30.

Friedman JN, Beck CE, DeGroot J, Geary DF, Sklansky DJ, Freedman SB. Comparison of isotonic and hypotonic intravenous maintenance fluids: a randomized clinical trial. JAMA Pediatr. 2015 May;169(5):445-51.
formula: 0-10 kg: 100 mL/kg/day; 10-20 kg: 1000 mL + 50 mL/kg for each kg over 10; >20 kg: 1500 mL + 20 mL/kg for each kg over 20
notes: Based on the Holliday-Segar method developed in 1957
Calculates maintenance fluid needs for healthy patients
Does not account for ongoing losses (fever, diarrhea, etc.)
Consider using isotonic solutions to prevent hyponatremia
Adjust for clinical condition and fluid balance status
May need modification in heart failure, renal disease, or liver disease
Monitor electrolytes and fluid balance regularly
Formula assumes normal renal function and no excessive losses
Consider restricting fluids in conditions with fluid retention
Neonates and premature infants may require different calculations
